content.question: Let <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the functions defined by <math alttext="g of x, equals, the sine of, open parenthesis, the fraction pi over 2, end fraction, times, open parenthesis, x plus 2, close parenthesis, close parenthesis, plus 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="h of x, equals, negative one fourth, times x cubed, minus three halves times x squared, minus nine fourths x, plus 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math>. If <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a function that satisfies <math alttext="g of x, is less than or equal to, f of x, is less than or equal to, h of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>≤</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>≤</mo><mi>h</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="negative 2 less than x, less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, what is <math alttext="the limit as x approaches negative 1, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The limit cannot be determined from the information given.

topic.text: 1.8: Determining Limits Using the Squeeze Theorem

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Confirm whether hypotheses or conditions of a selected definition, theorem, or test have been satisfied.
